SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Sinoso noyno kotowa noko gac?
Kowo soyo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Ach... I've no data on the language of
this world, so I cannae understand them.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Our apologies. Are you able
to understand us now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_060.text:
Ye can speak my language?
Oh, but that's a relief.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_070.text:
Be welcome in this land,
Soyay the Pollinator,
for we have summoned you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_090.text:
By the power of the god of the Imeru,
we have summoned you, the 40,846th
Soyay the Pollinator, to guide the
Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_091.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_091.text:
By the power of the god of we Imeru,
we have summoned you, Soyay the Pollinator,
to guide the Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_100.text:
If I may, what is this Epuyke
you're talking about?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_110.text:
The Epuyke is the blossom which gives life
to all that is in this world—and the maiden
is she who keeps the Epuyke alive. If the Epuyke does not blossom, all life
will wither and fade. To prevent this fate,
the maiden must cause it to bloom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_120.text:
And it is you, the Soyay,
who guides the Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_130.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_130.text:
Not sure why you're leaving such
an important role to a stranger.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_140.text:
All is as the god of the Imeru wills it.
This is part of the original promise made
between the god of the Imeru and Ancikar—
the evil which slumbers in the earth. But this is not something you need understand.
All that is asked of you is to guide the
Epuyke's maiden. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_150.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_150.text:
Wait, please! I've no idea what
I'm meant to be doing here!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_161.speaker: Constantine
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_161.text:
Well, that's quite the surprising
start to our time here! You hold the fate of this world in your
hands, my dear Diva. It's truly the perfect
circumstances under which to search for
your heart, wouldn't you say?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_170.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_170.text:
I wonder if the Epuyke has
anything to do with my heart?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_180.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_100_CUT_000_180.text:
Oh, I sense life over there. Maybe it's
this Epuyke's maiden I'm meant to meet.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome! Welcome to Dura Village,
Soyay the Pollinator! We have been eagerly
awaiting your arrival. Please, come this way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_010.text:
No need for the grand welcome, love;
I've done nothing to deserve it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Are you the Epuyke's maiden, then?
I've been told I need to guide ye,
but don't know how to get on with it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_040.text:
I am Lela, the Epuyke's maiden
for this season. I have been waiting for a Soyay to accompany
me through my trials, for it is said that
when maiden and Soyay overcome such together,
the Epuyke will endure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_050.text:
So I just need to accompany ye on
your trials, then? Understood.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_060.text:
The Epuyke ritual for the previous season has
already ended, and what time remains is short.
I apologize for having you set out so soon
after your arrival, but you must leave now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_070.text:
Ye must be a blood relative of Lela;
your genetic information is a 95% match.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_080.text:
Lela's mother—and I am delighted beyond
words that a maiden of Epuyke has been
chosen from my bloodline. Once Lela blooms into the Epuyke flower,
our family will at last be secure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_090.text:
So the Epuyke's maiden goes
on to become a flower?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_100.text: Yes, it's our role to do so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_110.text:
I suppose such things are rather common
in your world. Do all of ye turn into
flowers at some point, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_120.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_120.text:
What!? No! To become the Epuyke is an
indescribable honor that my family—
my daughter—has been chosen for.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_130.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_130.text:
You come from a different world, Soyay, so I
know this must all seem quite strange to you.
But the Epuyke will blossom soon, and I trust
you will understand when you see it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_140.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_140.text:
Go forth now, Soyay, and cultivate
my daughter into a beautiful Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_150.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_150.text:
I fear I'm not capable of cultivating anyone.
But if all I need to do is accompany Lela
on her trials, I think that's possible.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_160.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_160.text:
There's no time to waste, Soyay.
Let us be on our way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_170.speaker: Mother_Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_170.text:
May all luck be with you, Lela.
Go forth proudly for the sake
of our family and our lineage.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_180.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_100_CUT_000_180.text:
I look forward to
assisting ye, Lela.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_000.text:
I look forward to traveling with you
and completing the trials, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_010.text:
I assume ye know a lot about this world.
Do ye also know much about the heart?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_020.text:
If you have questions of the heart,
you should turn to the Epuyke. In our world, we have the god of the Imeru,
the god of the Kikir, and the most wicked
god Ancikar—and all hearts connect to them.
Does this have anything to do with our trials?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_030.text:
Nae, but I came to this world looking for my
heart, which is how I came to be entrusted
with the task of being your Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_040.text:
Still, if all hearts are connected to
the Epuyke, maybe I'll find mine
at the end of these trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_050.text:
I tried to picture what my Soyay might be
like after I was chosen to be the maiden,
but you are far, far different from
anything I ever imagined. That said, I do not feel nervous.
It is all simply...strange.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_060.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_060.text:
However, if the heart you are searching
for happens to be Ancikar, it might prevent
me from blossoming into the Epuyke.
This would be a very sad thing indeed.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_080.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_080.text:
The souls of all maidens who bloom into the
Epuyke live forever in the Maiden's Garden,
which is said to be a place of great joy. But I care not what sort of place
it might be; I care only that I will
finally see my Ahpe there again.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_100.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_100.text:
Ahpe is my only friend—one who is
undergoing preparations to bloom
into the Epuyke as we speak. The people claim she will no longer be Ahpe once
she becomes the Epuyke, but I do not believe this.
Ahpe will always be Ahpe—and when she blooms,
her soul will live on in the Maiden's Garden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_110.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_110.text:
I have been alone since she left, and...
I miss her. So please guide me well,
that I might bloom into the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_120.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_000_120.text:
And this Maiden's Garden is some manner of
afterlife, then? Either way, I've been given
the task of being your Soyay, so I'll do my
best to help ye turn into a flower.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_020_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_020_000.text:
Dreams of Ancikar—the evil who
slumbers deep within the earth—
have influenced this fiend.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_020_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_020_010.text:
Ancikar's dreams appear as fiends
during times of flood, but in times of
drought they appear as eggs instead. While we could easily crush the eggs,
none among us bother to do so,
for it is far simpler to just not travel
during times of flood.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_020_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_020_020.text:
Ancikar's fiends play an
important role, you see.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_000.text:
A huge plant just sprung out of the ground!
Aye, and it looks different from the other
ones. Is that the Epuyke, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_010.text:
Yes, it's the Epuyke—the flower that supports
our entire world. But it's also Ahpe, my friend.
Ahpe was reborn as the Epuyke, and I'm sure
she's going to blossom beautifully.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_020.text:
Are the Epuyke and the fiends connected
somehow? I analyzed the Epuyke's energy,
and some is the same as the fiends.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_030.text:
That is how Ancikar's fiends are, yes.
When a fiend dies, Ancikar's dreams—
which birthed said fiends—are absorbed
by the Epuyke. The Epuyke then takes Ancikar's dreams,
converts them to nutrients, and grows.
In this way are we kept safe from Ancikar.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_040.text:
Ancikar's dreams are the energy within fiends,
then? So the more we defeat, the larger the
Epuyke will grow—and the less people the
fiends can harm! Cracking brilliant plan, that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_050.text:
Yes. But if Ahpe's Epuyke grows too fast,
I will not be ready—for I must complete
my trials before it blossoms for Ahpe.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_060.text:
So by helping ye through your trials,
Ahpe's Epuyke will grow—and maybe
I'll also be able to find my heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_070.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_070.text:
You really are very different to how I was
imagining my Soyay to be; I thought it would
take you much longer to understand your role.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_080.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_080.text: Did I say something strange, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_090.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DORA_110_CUT_030_090.text:
Not at all; I've always known that each
Soyay will have their own way of thinking.
So long as you guide me properly through
my trials, I'll ask nothing more of you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyay the Pollinator.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Have you come to understand the Epuyke's
maiden a little better now, Soyay?
Are you ready to fulfill your role?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Aye, I've gathered heaps of data on the
maiden, and I am ready to do my duty—
both for Lela, and to find my own heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
It is unusual to see a Soyay so
eager to take on their role! But resolution is not enough to lead the
Epuyke's maiden—you also need strength.
I ask that you show this to me now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
When your heart is truly close to the
Epuyke's maiden, only then will you
display your true strength as Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You speak of the present Epuyke,
who I hear was once your friend.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text:
My apologies. I meant no offense. Ahpe's Soyay brilliantly overcame all
trials, which is why she bloomed into such
a healthy Epuyke. I only pray your Soyay
performs so admirably, Lela.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_0.text: How do we sort this trial, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.text: You must locate a fiend and kill it— but a fiend that is not one of Ancikar's. You must find the fiend, Soyay. This is a part of your trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.text:
Aye, that sounds like something
within my capabilities.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_100_CUT_000_1.text:
Never have I seen a Soyay so arrogant!
But go then, Soyay the Pollinator,
and guide well our maiden of Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Is this truly the place, Soyay?
I see nothing here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
I am the summoner of the strength fiends—
and I am surprised the two of you
discovered me so quickly.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
If I may ask a question, Summoner?
I understand why the Soyay must fight,
but what meaning does the act hold
for a maiden like myself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Once you witness the Soyay fighting,
you will understand in due course.
Do you stand ready, Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Then I shall summon the fiend.
O great god of the Kikir, bring us
a mighty fiend from a world beyond!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
We found the fiend and gave it a
proper thrashing, but neither of
us are exhibiting any changes.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
The fiend was defeated, but the Epuyke
is unchanged. Does this mean the trial
was a failure?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
This fiend was not born from Ancikar's dreams,
but summoned by the god of the Kikir from a world
beyond—summoned with the same power the god
of the Imeru uses to call Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
We Kikir use this power to fight Ancikar's
dream creatures, and have lost warriors
beyond counting in our battle for this land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
You have displayed the strength needed to draw
close to the Epuyke's maiden's heart, Soyay.
But tell me, Lela: what did you feel when you
witnessed the Soyay in battle?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
At first, I was afraid, my thoughts
dominated by what might happen
to me if the Soyay were to fail.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
But as I watched her desperate battle,
I found myself wishing for her victory—
not for my own sake, but because I simply
wanted to see her win. And when she finally proved victorious,
my heart overflowed with joy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
I have been alone ever since Ahpe became
the Epuyke. But now, I am not; I can walk
forward proudly beside the Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_110_CUT_010_0.text:
Hear me, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke:
I hereby deem you worthy to proceed
to the Trial of Love. I pray you will become our Epuyke, and ask
Soyay the Pollinator to guide you well.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Lela, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_010.text:
We Kikir, fellow residents of this world,
offer the Trial of Love to judge if you are
worthy to become the next season's Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Diva_No5

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Your emotions are irrelevant, Soyay.
You need only plant vine seeds within
the holes upon the plateau.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_040.text:
Small fiends of Ancikar may appear.
Defeat them to fertilize the seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_050.text:
If the maiden holds true love in her heart,
the seeds will immediately germinate
and grow into mighty vines.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_060.text:
And if they do not? Does this mean
I lack love and am not an appropriate
choice for the Epuyke's maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Love

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_080.text:
Well, I suppose I can handle a wee
spot of gardening. Let's go, Lela.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_090.text:
While I leave the decision of where to plant
the seeds to you, bear in mind these vines
will help our people move from place to place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_100.text:
How fine it will be to move between
plateaus without encountering fiends
during times of flood!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_130.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_130.text:
Is this 'Epuyke nogonoa kowo'
some kind of greeting, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_140.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_140.text:
You need not strain your
mental faculties, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_150.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_150.text:
It means, 'May the Epuyke blossom
be protected.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_160.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_100_CUT_000_160.text:
Again, I pray for your success in
this trial. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_000_000.text:
Should we put the seeds 
in this hole, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_000_010.text: Let us plant the seeds here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_010.text:
Is my heart truly loving enough?
What if I fail?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_020.text: Do hearts come in many types?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_030.text:
I can't say for sure, since they're not
something you can see with your eyes.
But I don't think so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_040.speaker: Diva_No5

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_010_050.text:
The seeds are in the ground, so I guess
now we just wait for the fiend that
serves as fertilizer to appear?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_020_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_020_000.text:
The seeds have been fertilized.
Now we wait for them to bloom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_000.text:
Oh, they bloomed! Ye clearly have a heart.
Now if only I knew where my own was...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_010.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_010.text:
It seems I have love in my heart after all.
But answer me this, Soyay the Pollinator:
do you have a name?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_110_CUT_030_020.text:
Well, my serial number is D05-72314,
but I'm usually called Songstress Diva
No. 5. Ye can call me Diva, if ye like.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Lela, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_010.text:
In this trial, you must collect fragments of
the Epuyke Tablet which have been scattered
across the land, put them back together,
and decipher the tale written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Both tablet and tale are said to have been
created for the Epuyke's maiden by the god
of the Imeru—and to be the physical form
of Ancikar's dreams.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_030.text:
The maiden, upon blooming into the Epuyke,
is no longer a person. She becomes more
akin to a god—to a part of this earth. This trial is a test to see if
you possess the wisdom needed
to become a part of the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_040.text:
Ahpe—I mean, the current Epuyke
collected these fragments as well,
did she not?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Ah, but she did more than simply collect
the fragments—she assembled the tablet,
deciphered the tale, and bloomed into
the Epuyke without being led astray. You have little time left,
Maiden Lela. Use it well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_060.text:
Do ye not have more data on this tablet?
We don't even know about how many fragments
there are or what it's meant to look like.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_070.text:
These are answers you know well, Soyay.
Now go lead the maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_080.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_100_CUT_000_080.text:
Looks like my scanning ability
is going to be put to the test.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_000.text:
This must be a fragment of the Epuyke Tablet.
There is something carved into it—writing,
perhaps? I fear I'll not be able to decipher
this even when fully assembled...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_010.text:
Ye won't know until ye try, love,
but it isn't worth trying until then.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Yes, I suppose you're right. It's best
to save such worries until we have
the tablet fully assembled.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_100_CUT_000_030.text: Let's find the next fragment, then.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_000.text:
This is a fragment of
the Epuyke Tablet.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_010.text:
I wonder where this tablet even
came from in the first place?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_020.text:
I am not certain; this is my first time
seeing them for myself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_030.text:
Truly, love? I thought ye would have
seen one before, seeing as this process
has been repeated 40,845 times.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_110_CUT_000_040.text:
Well yes, but it's not like I witnessed
all of the previous trials personally! Er, but now that I think on it, I've never
met anyone else who's seen a tablet, either.
I wonder why that is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_000.text:
This is a fragment of
the Epuyke Tablet.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_010.text:
These fragments are made of
a proper strange material.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_020.text:
It feels the same as the
husks of our birth seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_120_CUT_000_030.text:
Your people are born from seeds?
I dinnae know this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_000.text:
We've successfully gathered
all of the fragments.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_010.text:
We heard earlier that the tablets come from
the gods of the Imeru and Ancikar, but I cannae
find any evidence of that from analyzing them.
Still, I wonder what's written on it?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_020.text:
Ahpe read the tablet and became the Epuyke,
so the actual meaning matters very little.
I merely need to read it and bloom into
the Epuyke, as she did.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_130_CUT_000_030.text:
Let us return to the Witness to Wisdom
and assemble this as best we can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Lela, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_020.text:
How strange... I do not know this writing,
but when I put it together, I can read it.
I believe I am closer to the Epuyke now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_010_030.text:
I'll be waiting for ye here, love.
Just let me know once you've
finished reading it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_000.text:
Oh, but this is impossible! I am not meant
to be the Epuyke's maiden! I will never see
my beloved Ahpe again! I will be alone until
my foliage withers and—

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Lela—but you
must not give up. All is according to the will
of the Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_020.text:
So it's possible to become the Epuyke
without completing all the trials?
But what are they even for, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_000.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_000.text:
I did it! I read it!
Now I can finally meet Ahpe!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_020.text:
It was from Ahpe—she's waiting for me at the
Maiden's Garden! She even wrote about a secret
only she and I know, so it HAS to be from her! Oh, but I am so happy! I'm going to bloom
into a beautiful Epuyke and see her again!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_030.text:
If Ahpe became the Epuyke, maybe the
tablet is something the Epuyke makes
for the next maiden? If so, it means Ahpe's consciousness is still
in the Epuyke—and the heart of the Epuyke
is the heart of all its maidens.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_050.text:
With its role fulfilled, the tablet crumbles
to dust so none but the maiden might know
its tale. Such is the will of the Imeru's god.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_020_060.text:
Hear me, Lela, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_030_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_110_CUT_030_020.text:
It detailed all that has come to pass,
and all that is yet to come. Indeed,
I feel it is some manner of prophecy. But I also fear it might come across
in a negative way were I to speak of it,
so I think it best that I keep the
details to myself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Lela,
next Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_010.text:
We wish for you to bloom
just as beautifully.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_020.text: So Ahpe did it. She became the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Ahpe! It's me, Lela!
Can you see me!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_040.text:
That is but the Epuyke, Lela.
The one who was called Ahpe is no more.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_050.text:
My analysis indicates this is definitely the
Epuyke, but I see it's more than that to ye—
I just cannae understand what that is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_060.text:
I suggest you choose your words
more carefully, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_070.text:
I apologize if I caused
ye any offense.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_090.text:
We are beginning the Epuyke festival.
The Epuyke's pollen will now rain down
upon the earth, and we grant you special
permission to acquire it for yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_100_CUT_000_100.text:
Now go, before the Kikir
collect it all.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_000.text:
The Epuyke bloomed again this season!
We're getting our pollen!

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_010.text:
I've never seen anyone so
chuffed about pollen before.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_100_CUT_000_020.text:
I wonder what the quality of
this season's will be like?

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_000.text:
Another season, another successful
Epuyke festival.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_110_CUT_000_030.text:
I only hope I can get through
this without issue.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_000.text:
The Epuyke's pollen! Hooray!
We get our nutrients from this!

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_010.text:
So tasty! Epuyke forever!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_020.text:
I wonder if the evil deity Ancikar
truly does slumber underground.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_030.text:
I completed a scan of the underground,
and dinnae detect anything like what
they describe. Perhaps my sensors just
cannae detect the divine.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_040.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_120_CUT_000_040.text:
Only those in the Maiden's Garden
know the whole truth of it.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_000.text:
Eee hee hee! Festival time!
Epuyke pollen time!

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_010.text:
The Kikir LOVE Epuyke pollen!
Yummy yummy!

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_020.text: Is pollen really so tasty, then?

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_030.text:
Do not be tempted. Though its form may have
changed, this pollen was once the dreams of
evil Ancikar. If ingested you will become unable
to live without it, just like these Kikir.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_130_CUT_000_040.text:
Not a problem, love—this body
cannae ingest anything at all.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_020.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_020.text: Yes, I am in the middle of my trials.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_030.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_140_CUT_000_030.text:
Please bloom into a beautiful Epuyke
and feed us more delicious pollen.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_150_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_150_CUT_000_010.text:
Yummy, yummy! Such full tummy!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_010.text:
There is little pollen left on the Epuyke.
All that remains is for it to wither,
decay, and become one with the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_020.text: The Epuyke has little time remaining.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_030.text:
This means the ritual for the maiden
to bloom into the next Epuyke will
begin very soon.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_040.text:
We pray you might safely complete your
trials and blossom into an Epuyke that
rivals the one of this season.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_050.text:
Needless to say, I will do
all within my power.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_110_CUT_000_060.text:
You show promise, Maiden.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Lela!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_010.text:
The Epuyke has bloomed and withered.
Its soul has returned to the earth,
and now watches over and protects us.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_020.text:
And since the Epuyke absorbed Ancikar's
fell magic before it returned to the earth,
we now enjoy this brief moment of peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Alas, this is naught but a junction.
Maiden, the time has come for you
to be reborn anew into the Epuyke.
The time has come for the ritual.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Lela
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_050.text:
I'm going to meet Ahpe again,
right, Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_060.text:
I cannae give ye a definitive aye, love—
but nor can I give ye a definitive nae.
All ye can do now is go forth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_090.text:
The maiden has been reborn
as the Epuyke's seed.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_100.text:
Proper strange, this. It's a seed,
yet I still sense Lela from it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_000_110.text:
This is your final task, Soyay the Pollinator:
you must plant the Epuyke's seed in the earth.
Send it to Ancikar, that it might trap the wicked
god in slumber. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_000.text:
Never thought I'd end up planting your
seed, love—or that I'd be talking to a
seed, even. What's got into me?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's Epuyke
festival as the 40,846th Soyay the Pollinator.
I now pronounce you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_030.text:
Do ye mind if I stay here until
the Epuyke blooms? Or do I have
to be off right away?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_040.text:
Half the Soyays remain to watch the Epuyke
bloom, while the other half run away as
if for their very lives. I see now which
manner of Soyay you are.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_050.text:
Lela called the Epuyke a heart, so if
I stay to watch it bloom, I may learn
something about myself in the process.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_060.text:
And yet, you are now merely a thing.
We cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
40,847th Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_070.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_070.text: Got the next maiden already, do ye?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_080.text:
You are no longer Soyay the Pollinator.
Such matters do not concern you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_090.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_090.text:
Such is the cycle of this world.
I finally get it now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 40,846th Soyay the Pollinator!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_000.text:
Can you hear me there, love?
Ye grew so big and strong.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_040.text:
My analysis indicates the color of your flowers
is capable of greatly stimulating the visual senses
of those who view them. So yes, love: you're
beautiful as anything.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_060.text: Were ye able to meet Ahpe, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_090.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_100_CUT_020_090.text:
While I've no proof the Maiden's Garden
really exists, something inside me feels
certain she's there right now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.text:
This is Lela's pollen. It holds her genetic
information, but there's also something more.
The Epuyke is both Lela and not Lela at the
same time... It's all so very peculiar.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_000.text:
This is proof I once served as your Soyay.
I'll take it and treasure it always.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_010.speaker: Constantine
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_010.text:
Well then! You've finished this little Soyay duty
of yours, so we should probably be getting along.
The clerics will become quite the headache if we
tarry here too long, you know.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_010.text:
I understand why Lela called the Epuyke
a heart now, even if I cannae really
put what it means into words.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_010.speaker: Constantine
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_100_CUT_010.text:
Oh? This world didn't come off as
all that important a place to me,
but bully for you, I suppose.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
I am D05-72314, otherwise known as Songstress
Diva No. 5. I'm here looking for my heart—do ye
know anything that might help guide me to it?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_030.text:
Ye say I was summoned, then?
What does that mean?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_050.text:
Pardon us. It seems none of what
we said got through to you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_060.text:
I understand the individual words ye said,
but the overall message makes no sense.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_080.text: I apologize for speaking out of turn.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_090.text:
By the power of the god of we Imeru,
we have summoned you, the 80,136th
Soyay the Pollinator, to guide the
Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_100.text:
I don't even know what an Epuyke
or a Soyay are, so what exactly
am I meant to be doing here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_130.text:
Nae, I cannae possibly do that!
How am I supposed to guide someone
in a world I know nothing about?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_170.speaker: Constantine
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_170.text:
I wonder what a Soyay's even supposed to do?
Oh well, I'm sure you'll be fine either way.
Just think of guiding this maiden as a quick
way to find that heart of yours.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_171.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_200_CUT_000_171.text:
I cannae help but feel it won't be
that simple. But if this is what it
takes to find my heart, I'll do it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome to Doroso Village,
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_020.text:
No. I am Kup, younger sister to this
year's maiden, Chup. My sister—

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_030.text:
Her sister does not WANT to be
the stupid Maiden of the Epuyke,
thank you very much. Look, you're the Soyay, right? How about you
just get me out of here and take me back
to whatever world you came from?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_040.text:
Are ye certain? I was told the Epuyke's
maiden keeps this world alive.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_050.text:
But we must have a maiden, Sister!
Elsewise the land will wither away!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_070.text:
I would love to, Sister—AND I'd do a
much better job than you! But I can't,
because the markings of the Imeru
are already on you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_080.text:
This year's Epuyke is already budding!
If you don't do your part as the maiden,
we're all going to die!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_090.text:
Meh, who cares? If we die, all the
clerics in the city will just say,
'This, too, is fate!' or whatever.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_100.text:
Why are you ALWAYS like this, Chup!?
You run around doing whatever you want,
which means I have to behave like a
good girl because you NEVER do! IT'S NOT FAAAIR! WAAAAAAH!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_110.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_110.text: Oh, but this is a proper mess.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_120.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_120.text:
Ugh. Fiiine. Whatever. I'll do it.
Sheesh! I just wanted to give her
a bit of a hard time, but then she
started crying and made it weird.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_130.text:
Come on then, Soyay.
Let's go do the trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_140.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_140.text:
Okay, Kup, I'm off to do the trials,
but I don't know if it'll go well—and
to be honest, I still had lots of things
I wanted to do in life. Happy now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_160.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_160.text:
So do I accompany ye
on your trials, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_170.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_170.text:
Tradition says the Maiden of the Epuyke must
walk with the Soyay. As she does, she finds her
resolve to become the Epuyke by completing
trials of power, wisdom, and love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_180.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_180.text:
Ye certainly seem to know
heaps about all of this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_190.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_190.text:
Oh, that's something all Imeru know.
Sis is just...special.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_210.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_210.text:
I suppose I'm special in a sense—
but I'm sure not happy about it!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_220.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_220.text:
Please, Sis! You have to formally
request the Soyay's help!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_230.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_000_230.text:
Fine, whatever. Please help me,
O great Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_000.text:
Man, no matter what argument we're
having, once she busts out the tears
it's my loss. It's always been like that,
ever since we were little.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_010.text:
And now, for some who-knows-why reason,
I'm this season's Maiden of the Epuyke
even though my earnest little sister
would be WAY better at it! Sucks for you having to be
the Soyay in my season.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_020.text:
Apologies, love. I've only just arrived in
this world, so there's loads I don't know.
I just hope I can be of use to ye.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_030.text: Wait, so I'm the one in trouble here!? Well in that case, I'm glad it's me here instead of my little sister. I mean, not that any of it matters; this Epuyke festival is probably the last one anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_040.text:
Would that spell the end
of this world, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_050.text:
Probably? I don't really know the details;
it's the god of the Imeru who picks the
Maiden and the Soyay and all that. All I know is that I don't want to make
my sister cry again, so you better do
your damn job properly!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_060.text:
Well, I'm certainly going to try, but I don't have
the faintest idea what I'm supposed to do.
Will the god of the Imeru give me instructions
at some point, do ye think?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_DOROSO_200_CUT_010_070.text:
Ugh, this is just the worst.
You're the Soyay, remember?
It's YOUR job to lead ME. Anyway, the trials. There are three of
them, so please just...do your job.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyay the Pollinator.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Answer me, Maiden! Do you understand
why Soyay the Pollinator must now face
the Trial of Strength?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Yeah, it's because I can't fight—but
I don't get why that means she has to.
I mean, all I have to do here is turn
into the Epuyke, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
In order to bloom into the Epuyke, you must
defeat Ancikar's fiends. If the current Epuyke
does not blossom, it means the next maiden
will never take her rightful place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Which means I'll stay the maiden forever
and never become the Epuyke...which I
wouldn't mind, if we're being honest.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
If the Epuyke does not blossom, we will never
receive its pollen. We Kikir toil day in and day
out so we might receive this gift, and it is the
duty of the maiden and Soyay to make it so!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Might ye explain what
this trial involves?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text: You must locate a fiend and kill it— but a fiend that is not one of Ancikar's. You must find the fiend, Soyay. This is a part of your trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Find a fiend and thrash it?
Aye, I can do that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_0.text:
You're weirdly confident about this.
Hope that confidence isn't misplaced.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_200_CUT_000_1.text:
And now, Soyay the Pollinator,
guide well the Maiden of the Epuyke!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
Well, we're at a big empty spot.
What do I do now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text: This is where we'll find the fiend.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
I am the summoner of the Fiend of Strength,
and am glad the two of you discovered me.
Now watch as I bring forth the fiend into
this world!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text: Hey. Is this really going to be okay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text: Stay back, love. This is dangerous.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_000_0.text:
Well, Epuyke nogonoa kowo,
I guess?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.text:
The fiend's been slain. Does this mean
the Trial of Strength is over, then?
Because I cannae see that anything
changed as a result.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.text:
You have done well in the Trial of Strength,
Maiden, and I pray you might bloom into a
beautiful Epuyke. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_210_CUT_010_0.text:
Wait, is that really it?
I mean, uh, Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Chup, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love. Your task is thus: take these
vine seeds and plant them in
the holes upon the plateaus.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_010.text:
Small fiends of Ancikar may appear—defeat them
to fertilize the seeds. If the maiden holds true
love in her heart, the seeds will immediately
germinate and grow into mighty vines.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_020.text:
So we're spreading vine seeds?
What's so romantic about that?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_030.text:
The vines that grow will aid you
and all the people. This is love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_040.text: Yeaaah, sorry, but I don't really have love in my heart—and I absolutely don't want or need to help 'the people.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_060.text:
I just don't need this creep pushing a bunch
of stupid charity work on me when I'm already
busy trying not to make my sister cry!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Take the seeds of the transport vines,
and know I will pray for you to safely
overcome your trial. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_200_CUT_000_080.text:
It doesn't look like we have a choice—
but at least planting seeds should be
a simple enough thing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_000_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_000_000.text:
This hole seems ideal for seeds.
Should we plant them here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_010_000.text:
Look, let's just throw the seeds on the
ground and let 'em grow on their own.
That's what seeds do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_010_010.text:
The witness said fiends would also
appear and become nutrients.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_020_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_020_000.text:
Well, this all seems to the good.
Now we just wait for them to bud.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_030_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_210_CUT_030_000.text:
Am I one of these vines?
Or am I a fiend of Ancikar?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_010.text:
Do you understand what this
trial entails, Maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_020.text:
Um... You're gonna give me a test
to see how smart I am?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_030.text:
Our intelligence is nothing in comparison
to the god of the Imeru. No, the wisdom
asked of you here will determine if you
can reflect upon yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_040.text:
I sense confusion in your mien,
so permit me to explain. In this trial, you must collect fragments of
the Epuyke Tablet which have been scattered
across the land, put them back together,
and decipher the tale written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_070.text:
And I can understand the tale
if I'm wise enough?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Precisely so—for only the Epuyke's
maiden can decipher the story.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_090.text:
Do ye not have more data on this tablet?
We don't even know about how many fragments
there are or what it's meant to look like.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_100.text:
These are answers you know well, Soyay,
for this is what it means to be you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_200_CUT_000_130.text:
I always get tongue-tied saying this,
but...Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_000.text:
This is a fragment of the Epuyke Tablet,
but I have ZERO idea what it says.
...Does that mean I'm stupid?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_010.text:
Nae, love. We haven't found all the fragments,
so ye won't be able to decipher their meaning
until that happens.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_020.text:
Okay, whew! I was worried for
a hot second there. But CAN I put them together, though?
And can I even FIND all the fragments
since my Soyay is so...you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_030.text:
I'm so sorry I cannae be
of more help to ye.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_040.text:
Oh, don't let it get you down. I mean,
my sister and I have special memories
of this place, but there's no way you'd
have known that. Honestly, the fact you even found it
probably proves you're a decent Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_050.text:
What kind of memories do ye mean?
I've no such things of my own.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_060.text:
So it was a popular place to search for
pretty rocks when we were kids—we used
to run around looking for these big, shiny
pieces of crystal. ...And whenever my sister found one,
I'd take it and claim it for myself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_070.text:
I really am a terrible person...
But I guess that doesn't matter now,
because my memories will all vanish
as soon as I become the Epuyke...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_200_CUT_000_080.text:
Whoops! Man, listen to me!
Talking like my becoming the
Epuyke is guaranteed to happen.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_010.text:
So these fragments just come out of the
ground when a new maiden is chosen, then?
I wonder why that is?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_020.text:
No idea. People don't normally just stumble
on them—I'd actually never seen one before
being chosen for all this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_030.text:
Then I'll consider myself fortunate
and try to collect all the data I can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_040.text:
Wanna take this back with you, then?
Sell it for mad cash?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_050.text:
...KIDDING! Ha ha, your face! Y'know, I come here by myself sometimes
to take in the view of the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_060.text:
I've always wondered what it feels like to
turn into the Epuyke, but I never thought
I'd...you know. Find out for myself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_070.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_070.text:
The god of the Imeru chooses both the maiden
and the Soyay, aye? But I lack records
indicating I ever met such a person. So what was it like when ye were
chosen to be the Epuyke's maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_210_CUT_000_080.text:
The god of the Imeru didn't pop up in my dreams
or anything, if that's what you're asking.
I just woke up one day, saw all these markings
on my face, and knew that was that. Honestly, I'm glad I never met our god,
'cause I'd probably wanna punch him.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_000.text:
And there's an Epuyke Tablet fragment.
They feel the exact same as the husks
of our birth seeds, so I can always tell.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_010.text:
Your people are born
from seeds, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_020.text:
Wait, are you NOT!?
Eeeeeew! Groooss!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_030.text:
...KIDDING! Yes, again.
Don't get all offended. You know, I wish you'd talk more about
yourself. Like, how you're born and
stuff like that? But I guess we don't
really have that kind of time, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_040.text:
But, um, hey. If I do actually manage
to become the Epuyke, will you...
tell my sister about your world?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_220_CUT_000_050.text:
I don't even know where
my world is, love...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_010.text:
I wonder what it says? Perhaps it's
some kind of code that only the maiden
of the Epuyke is able to read.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_020.text:
What if it said, 'Ha ha! Just kidding!
You're not the maiden after all!'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_230_CUT_000_040.text: Let go back to the witness, then.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Chup, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_000_030.text:
Epi... Epa...? Uhhh...
Oh, right. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_010_030.text:
Of course. It is a revelation
meant for you alone.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_000.text:
I don't think I can do this...
I wasn't the Epuyke's maiden after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Chup—but you
must not give up. All is according to the will
of the Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_020.text:
Aw, man! I thought the maidens could
quit halfway through if they wanted,
but I guess not. Can't believe you're making me go through
this whole thing even though you know
how much I suck at it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_030.text:
There's still hope ye may
be able to read it, love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_050.text: But it's all right to give up.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_020.text:
It was all about my little sister—about how
she's always loved me even though all I've
ever done is cause problems for our family.
...I think I understand now why I was chosen.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_020_050.text:
Hear me, Chup, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_020.text: It's a secret. One just for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_210_CUT_030_030.text:
The words of the tablet may remain
forever in your heart if you wish it.
My role is to witness, not to know.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hold on a moment, Chup. I'm going
to search for where we go next.
...Chup? Where'd ye go, love?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
What is the matter,
Soyay the Pollinator?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_030.text:
So she has run. Well, it is not as
though this is unprecedented.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_040.text:
If we cannot find the maiden before the
Epuyke withers, we will have no choice
but to graft.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_060.text:
Grafting involves choosing a substitute
from the maiden's direct family and
casting the spell on them.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_070.text:
I thought only the god of the Imeru
could choose the maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_080.text:
The maiden alone does not face the trials.
Tens of thousands of times have we repeated
the Epuyke ritual, and in that span we have
seen all manner of circumstances.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_090.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_090.text:
But if ye plan to use the maiden's
direct family, does that mean...?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_100.text:
We will cast the spell on the maiden's
little sister, Kup, and form her in a way
that is as close to Chup as possible.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_110.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_110.text:
Aye, I suppose that's possible so long as
their genetic information is similar.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_120.text:
I had been hoping the god of the Imeru might
choose Kup to begin with, for I feared exactly
this outcome. But alas, the ways of the divine
are mysterious, even to us.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_130.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_130.text:
Still, we cannae be sure Chup actually
did a runner. Let me go look for her.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_200_CUT_000_140.text:
We can wait only until the Epuyke withers.
If she does not return before then,
Kup must be grafted.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_040.text:
You must stay here, Kup. We cannot
risk your running off as well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_050.text:
I trust you are familiar with the spell
of grafting? We are considering it as
a possible option.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_070.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_070.text:
It's still too soon to say;
she may not have gone.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_080.text:
No, it's all right. I'll be the maiden
if that's what Sis wants. But...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_090.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_090.text:
But before I do, I have to talk to her.
Please, Soyay. Find her for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_110.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_210_CUT_000_110.text:
Make haste, Soyay the Pollinator, for
you have only until the Epuyke withers.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_000.text:
Ugh, you found me ALREADY?
Seriously, what even are you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_010.text:
Ye caught us all by surprise
disappearing as ye did.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_020.text:
I just wanted to be alone, okay? I wanted to
think about how I might look as the Epuyke,
and how the whole thing might...feel. And I was really close to an answer,
but then YOU showed up! Ugh!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_030.text:
I'm terribly sorry about that, love,
but I though ye might want to know
they're going to graft your sister.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_220_CUT_000_040.text: What!? No! I need to go back!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_221_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_221_CUT_000_010.text:
I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sooorry!
Your dumb big sister took a little detour,
and now everybody's lost their damn minds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_221_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_221_CUT_000_020.text:
Should the Epuyke vanish, Ancikar will begin
to awaken. You carry a great burden as the
Maiden of Epuyke, Chup—do you seek to have
this lifted from your shoulders?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_221_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_221_CUT_000_030.text:
Look, I wasn't running away, okay?
I just needed a little alone time. But I'm back now, so just leave
my sister out of this and let
me finish the stupid thing!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_221_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_221_CUT_000_060.text:
I got this, Kup. It's okay.
I'm your big sister, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_010.text:
Oh. Hey, Soyay. Sorry for taking off,
but I just had this random thought. So remember how I told you about the
pretty rocks when we came here? Well,
I wanted to find a nice one for Kup.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_020.text:
Oh, I see. But while you were away,
the clerics started a bunch of talk
about grafting your sister.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_030.text:
What!? Oh, come on already!
Why doesn't anyone here TRUST me?
I mean, I was CHOSEN, remember!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_040.text:
I can't speak on their behalf, love.
All I know is we have to get back
before the Epuyke withers.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_050.text:
But I still haven't found a good rock!
Search with me, Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_230_CUT_000_060.text:
Very well. What kind do ye need?
What color and shape should it be?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_231_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_231_CUT_000_010.text:
Aye, and it meets the conditions
ye laid out earlier.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_231_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_231_CUT_000_020.text:
I can't believe I get YOU as a Soyay.
I got my hopes up for nothing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_231_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_231_CUT_000_030.text:
Oh, whoa... This is so pretty...
But isn't it a piece of an Ancikar fiend?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_231_CUT_000_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_231_CUT_000_040.text:
Aye, but it's also compositionally an
eggshell. Now let's get a wiggle on
and head back to the village!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_232_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_232_CUT_000_040.text:
Hey, Kup. So remember how we used to collect
rocks and I'd always take whatever you found?
I know it was a long time ago, but I'm still sorry.
So...I got you this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_232_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_232_CUT_000_060.text:
The Soyay helped me find it.
Pretty great, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_232_CUT_000_070.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_RUN_232_CUT_000_070.text:
Thank you, Sis.
I'll always treasure it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Chup,
Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_020.text:
I know. And if I'm going to bloom,
I'm going to be stunning—but I won't
be doing it for you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_030.text:
So what was the name of
this season's Epuyke maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_040.text:
The present Epuyke was once
an individual named Wakka.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_050.text:
So if I become the Epuyke, am I going
to be 'an individual once named Chup'?
Ugh. Can't say I feel good about that. Here's the deal: when I make the most
beautiful blossoms—and I am TOTALLY going
to make the most beautiful blossoms—
I want you to say 'Wooo! Chup rules!'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Not NOW, you dingbat! But yeah,
like that. Except maybe with a
little more feeling.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
