SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
You make it sound like
it grew all on its own...

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_030.text: This is the Epuyke festival, then?

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_020.text:
This was fun when I was a kid, but now
I realize I didn't get it at ALL.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_030.text:
So ye don't find it fun now?
Why would your feelings change so?

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_020.text:
Boy, they're really going nuts...
I wonder if my pollen will taste
that good.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_030.text:
I dinnae even know pollen had a taste
before now. I wonder what determines it?
The genetics of whoever produces it?
The environment they were raised in?

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_040.text:
Your guess is as good as mine.
Anyway, let's go.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_030.text:
If you eat the pollen,
you turn into a Kikir.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_040.text:
I never knew pollen had such properties!
This is worthwhile knowledge.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_240_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_240_CUT_000_020.text:
I'm in the middle of my
trial thingies.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_210_CUT_000_050.text:
I'll do what I can, okay?
That's all I can really promise.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Chup!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_050.text:
Hey, know what I just realized, Soyay?
I never asked your real name.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_060.text:
I am D05-72314, otherwise known
as Songstress Diva No. 5.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Ha ha ha! Man, that name is bonkers.
But thanks for everything, Diva.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_100.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_100.text:
Proper strange, this. It's a seed,
yet I still sense Chup from it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_000_080.text:
No! Ancikar has possessed
the maiden's body!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_000.text:
As we suspected, maidens who run from their
trials are tainted; I fear Ancikar has crept into
the crevices of her heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_010.text:
I sense magical energy similar to the fiends
coming from that flower. Perhaps she absorbed
too much energy, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_020.text:
We must cut down that wicked blossom.
If we do not, Ancikar's power will spread
out across the land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_030.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_030.text: Stop! Don't cut down my sister!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_040.text:
I knew I wasn't capable of guiding a person
like ye wanted me to—or perhaps this was all
meant to happen, and this is just another
trial I must overcome to find my heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_050.text:
I've a suggestion, love—and though I give me
plan a 50% chance of succeeding, we may save
your sister if it works. Will ye help me?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_060.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_060.text: Of course! Please save her, Soyay!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_070.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_070.text:
This is our final trial.
Let's overcome it together!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_090.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_090.text: I hear you, Sis! It's me! Kup!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_020_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_020_000.text:
Can ye hear me, Chup? Ye can do it!
Just be strong, love!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_000.text:
Though the wicked blossom has withered,
the Epuyke ritual has failed. What might
our god be thinking in all of this? I fear this
may portend the end of the world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_010.text:
Nae, Chup is still alive. 'Tis only a
matter of time before she absorbs
the fiends' nutrients and blossoms.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_020.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_020.text:
Please trust in my sister.
Trust in the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_030.text:
We are guided by the Imeru god's will,
and so shall watch over the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_000.text:
Can you hear me, Sis?
You're SUCH a pretty flower!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_010.text:
Thank you, Kup...
I heard...your voice...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_020.text:
I'm so sorry for being such
a terrible Soyay, love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_030.text:
Heh. Yeah, you were pretty lousy...
But thanks all the time, Diva...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_000.text:
In the end, I wasn't able to prove
the existence of a 'god of the Imeru.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's Epuyke
festival as the 80,136th Soyay the Pollinator.
I now pronounce you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_030.text:
Should I remain here until the
Epuyke's flowers bloom, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_040.text:
Half the Soyays remain to watch the Epuyke
bloom, while the other half run away as
if for their very lives. What will you do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_050.text:
I'll stay here and observe
what happens to the end.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_060.text:
And yet, you are now merely a thing.
We cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
80,137th Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 80,136th Soyay the Pollinator!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_000.text:
Can you hear me, Sis?
You're SUCH a pretty flower now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.text:
This is Chup's pollen. It holds her genetic
information, but there's also something more.
The Epuyke is both Chup and not Chup at the
same time... It's all so very peculiar.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.text: This is proof that I was your Soyay. Thank you, Chup.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_010.text:
I'm so glad I was chosen to be Soyay.
I don't know why I feel that way,
but I know I do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_060.text: What kind of world is this, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_080.text: I apologize for speaking out of turn.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_090.text:
By the power of the god of the Imeru,
we have summoned you, the 1,080,362nd
Soyay the Pollinator, to guide the
Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_100.text:
Aye, but I don't even know what an Epuyke
or a Soyay are. What exactly am I meant
to be doing here, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_130.text:
Not sure why you're leaving such
an important role to a stranger.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_140.text:
All is as the god of the Imeru wills it.
This is part of the original promise made
between the god of the Imeru and Ancikar—
the evil which slumbers in the earth. Alas, this season's maiden is quite the handful,
which is why I believe you have been summoned.
For of all possible Soyays in all the worlds,
you are best suited for this task.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_150.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_150.text: I have my doubts about that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_160.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_160.text:
Now go forth and guide the maiden.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_171.speaker: Constantine
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_171.text:
Perhaps the god of the Imeru is aware
you're searching for your heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_172.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_172.text:
Which means I may find my own
if I fulfill my duty as a Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome to Berta Village,
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Hello. I'm D05-72314, otherwise known as
Songstress Diva No. 5. I was appointed to
be your Soyay a short time ago.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Your greeting is recognized and appreciated.
I am called Yuk, and my daughter, Nana,
is who you will be guiding on her quest
to become a wonderful Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Sorry! Sorry. Know I'm late—had to change,
what with me being the maiden and all.
Never really worn anything like this
before, but whatcha gonna do, am I right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_040.text:
Are the two of ye truly parent and child?
Because both physically and genetically,
ye are nothing alike.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_050.text: Yeah, you're not wrong about that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Though our appearances differ, I raised Nana
as my daughter. Even our god can see she is
a proud Imeru on the inside, for this is why
she was granted the markings.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_070.text:
Fascinating! I assume ye just
drew them on yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_080.text:
Nope! I just woke up one morning
and BAM! Face markings. The village freaked out, because they couldn't
believe 'that Nana'—which is how they say my name,
by the way, super judgy—they couldn't believe
'that Nana' had been chosen to be the maiden. You should have seen their faces. Seriously,
like, EVERY jaw was dragging across the ground
and their eyes were all bugging out. It made
all this maiden business completely worth it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_090.text:
The god of the Imeru has chosen my daughter,
and though I know she will bloom into a most
beautiful Epuyke, I still remain uneasy.
So please, Soyay—guide her well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_100.text:
And what does this guidance involve?
So sorry, but I just arrived here and
know nothing about anything.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_110.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_110.text:
Okay, so basically I have to go pass three
trials: strength, wisdom, and love. As my Soyay,
you and me have to work together to overcome
them before the next Epuyke withers.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_130.text:
It's a big... Well, it's this... Look, it's gonna
be way easier to just show you, okay?
The Epuyke is gonna bloom while we're working
on the trials, so you can see it then. Cool?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_140.text:
Aye, that's fair. I'll avoid
thinking about it for now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_150.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_150.text:
Then let's quit standing here
and get going already! C'mon!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_160.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_160.text:
Please take care of my Nana,
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_200.text:
Okay, so let me introduce myself again:
I'm Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke. And this part I didn't want to say in front
of Mom, but I wasn't born in this world.
I mean, obviously, but figured I should just
get it all out there anyway, you know? Yeah, so I came here with another Soyay,
but when they left me behind, Mom decided
to raise me as her own. That's the story.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_210.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_210.text:
Anyway, apparently the Soyay who brought me
here wore these clothes, and for some reason
Mom insisted I wear them on my trials.
So that's why I'm dressed like this. Oh hey! Once the Epuyke ritual is over,
do you think I'll go back to the world
that Soyay came from?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_220.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_220.text:
They say animals have homing instincts,
so it wouldn't surprise me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_230.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_230.text:
I dunno. I mean, I'd LOVE to get out there
and visit strange worlds, you know?
But I'm also from here, so I can't
imagine living out there forever.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_240.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_240.text:
Anyway, now you know the whole story.
So be my guide, Soyay, and be a good one.
Let's go do this thing! Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_250.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_250.text:
What would I feel if I found the world I'm from?
Would I be able to claim it as my own like Nana?
But nae, no point thinking about this now;
we need to concentrate on the ritual.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Do you know what this
trial entails, Nana?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_020.text:
The Trial of Wisdom is a test of one's wisdom,
knowledge, and discretion, and is undertaken
to determine whether or not a maiden is suited
to become the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_030.text:
I am pleased to see you were not raised by
Yuk with nothing to show for it. That said,
the Trial of Wisdom also reaffirms your
connection with the land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_040.text:
So I'll be looking back on the
time I've spent here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_050.text:
If I may speak plainly, we are all
rather perplexed as to why the god
of the Imeru has chosen you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Okay, seriously? I've got TONS of memories
with the land, which the god of the Imeru
would totally know. I am an Imeru, just like
everyone else. It isn't that hard.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_070.text:
This is true—and yet, we cannot help but
look at the differences which separate you
from the rest of our kind. Perhaps this is a revelation from the god of
the Imeru asking us to be more considerate of
what lies inside? Regardless, I pray you might 
overcome the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_090.text:
She must collect fragments of the Epuyke Tablet
which have been scattered across the land,
put them back together, and decipher the tale
written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_120.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_120.text:
Oh, I'm going to decipher it, all right—
and when I do, you'll see that my heart
is no different from yours!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_130.text:
We've very little data on these fragments.
Is this also part of the trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_140.text:
You have seen the truth of it, Soyay.
Now go find the fragments and return to me.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Look! A fragment of the Epuyke Tablet!
Oh, and there's a pattern carved on it!
Am I supposed to decipher this? Really?
Because I have ZERO idea what I'm looking at.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Do ye think someone carved
it deliberately?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Yeah, so I've heard the tablet is actually
born at the same time the maiden appears?
It grows up from the ground just like this. Some people say the dreams of the Ancikar are
carved into it, but other people say it actually
contains a divine message from the Imeru god.
Truth is, nobody knows for sure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Oh, and I was also told the fragments would
appear in places that are important to me,
but I've never even BEEN to this place before,
so that's just weird.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_010.text:
Is there any pattern to the
location of these fragments?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_020.text:
Mom used to bring me here sometimes—she'd
stare at the Epuyke and then cry all quietly.
I'd always pretend not to notice, because I
just had a feeling I wasn't supposed to ask.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_030.text: Why did ye feel that way, love?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_040.text:
I...don't know. Sorry.
I can't put it into words. I guess thought a lot about the maidens and how
they must've felt when they became the Epuyke.
Like, were they embarrassed to have everyone
staring at them? Or were they proud?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_050.text: Still, even with all that thinking, I never imagined I'd be chosen to be the maiden. Always figured it'd be someone else's problem.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_060.text:
Did something change inside
when ye became the maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_310_CUT_000_070.text:
I dunno. I just wonder if Mom's gonna look
at me and cry once I turn into the Epuyke.
That's all I can think about right now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_020.text:
Oh wow, this is the same as our birth-seed husks!
See, whenever an Imeru is born, the parents save
the husk and turn it into some kind of accessory
the kids can wear around.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_030.text:
But I never got an accessory—and when I asked Mom
why, she didn't know how to answer. Of course,
now I know it's because I wasn't born from a seed,
but at the time it made zero sense.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_040.text:
Anyway, one day she brought out this super old
husk from the storehouse and said it was mine,
but I knew that wasn't true. So I burst out
crying and she just kind of...stood there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_060.text:
Later, I went to the storehouse and found
the box where the husk was stored. The name
'Nuy' was written on it, but I've never
gotten up the guts to ask Mom who that is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_070.text:
...Wow. I've never told anyone that
story before. I suppose this means
I really trust you, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_080.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_320_CUT_000_080.text:
I appreciate ye telling me that, love.
Still, since I don't have a heart,
I'm afraid I struggle to understand
the meaning of what ye say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_020.text:
I don't know—but while the witness got under
my skin a little earlier, I'm calmer now.
So whatever it says, I'm not going to be
surprised by it... Probably.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_TABLET_330_CUT_000_030.text: I hope it's proof of your heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Nana, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_030.text:
Of course. It is a revelation
meant for you alone.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_040.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_040.text:
As your witness, I was unsure if the tablet
fragments would grow—or if your Soyay would
even be able to find them. But the will of the Imeru god is ever wise,
and I am relieved to see you were able to
complete the trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_050.text:
You know, people have always said terrible
things about me behind my back—called me an
animal and worse. And Mom... Well, you don't
even want to KNOW the things they said to her. But you know what? Screw 'em. I'm gonna
become the Epuyke and bless this land
no matter WHAT they all think of me!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_000.text:
Oh, who am I kidding!? I can't do this!
I'm not an Imeru, I don't have a husk—
there's no WAY I can put this together! Clearly, the god of the Imeru just gave
me these markings as a punishment.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Nana—you must
not give up. All is according to the will of the
Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_020.text:
So it's possible to become the Epuyke
without completing all the trials?
But what are they even for, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_030.text:
Sorry. I'm sorry.
Just lost myself a bit.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_050.text: I can't do it. There's no way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_000.text:
Okay, so I read the tablet, and it
told me to go to the Kieru Ruins.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_010.text:
I see. You may reach the ruins by taking the
branching path managed by the Kikir in the
cavern that connects to Doroso Village.
I will notify the Kikir to expect you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_020.text:
Is going to those ruins also
part of the trial, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_030.text:
No. The trial ended when the maiden finished
deciphering the tablet. Whether or not you
choose to follow the tablet's instruction
is up to the two of you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_040.text:
Do ye know anything
about the Kieru Ruins?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_050.text:
I don't know—I've never been.
The Kikir manage that area,
so the Imeru don't go there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_080.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_080.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_100.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_100.text:
We've two choices, love: we can go to
the Kieru Ruins, or we can prioritize
your duty as the maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_110.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_110.text:
The tablet is a revelation from the god of the
Imeru—and though I am not Imeru, I know I was
given these markings for a reason, so I feel
like I have to do as the tablet says...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_130.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_130.text: So let's go find the ruins.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_030.text:
The words of the tablet may remain
forever in your heart if you wish it.
My role is to witness, not to know.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_060.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the Epuyke ritual.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_070.text:
I'll do what I can, but I just don't know
how this is going to turn out.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator! I hear the revelation on the Epuyke Tablet
bid you come to this place. This will be an
inconvenience to the people of Doroso Village,
but they will simply have to make their peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_300_CUT_000_010.text:
The path is connected—please go ahead.
Also, so far as I know, there is nothing
within the Kieru Ruins, but I trust it is
important to you. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_000.text:
Aye, this ruin is old, but I see
evidence it was used in the past.
People may even have lived here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_020.text:
Did it stir something
in your memory, love?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_030.text: Do you mind if I walk ahead?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_000_060.text:
Aye, all right—but if anything goes
pear-shaped, yell and I'll come running!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_000.text:
I found this on the ground—there's something
written on it that I can't read. I think it may
have belonged to a past Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_010.text: It's some kind of notebook. May I?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_030.text:
Aye, this language is in my database.
Just give me a moment, please.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.text:
'For reasons unclear, I have been summoned
to this world by some sort of magic. I am apparently
meant to walk with someone labeled a 'maiden'
and aid her in a series of trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.text:
But I have only a few days supply
of both diapers and milk remaining,
and I don't know what to do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_080.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_080.text:
I was right! This WAS left
by a previous Soyay!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.text:
'When I awoke, I thought for a moment this
 had all been a dream, but it was not to be.
Time is...strange here—fluid—which is why
I have decided to write all of this down.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.text:
The easiest way to return to my world is to 
abandon the maiden, but am torn as to whether
or not this is an ethical decision to make. I have no one else to talk to.
I don't know what to do.
I cannot leave Nana alone.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.text:
'I spoke to the clerics; the maiden's
mother will look after Nana while I'm off
helping her daughter on the trials. I know Nuy will not return home if I am
successful, and yet I still feel this is
something I must do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_160.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_160.text:
I've confidence in my translation software,
but I can explain more about the source
language if it would set your mind at ease.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.text:
'Today, I set out on my trials
with the maiden, Nuy. Her mother, Yuk, will be taking care of Nana
while I'm away—and even though Yuk's own
daughter is going to become the Epuyke,
all she does is fuss over me and Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.text:
I don't know much about this world, but I do
know this: Yuk is a good person—even though
I would lose my mind if someone told me
Nana had to become this Epuyke thing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.text:
When these trials are over—when we return
to our world and Nana grows up—I'll tell
her about everything that happened here. She's probably going to think I'm making
it up—or that I'm mad—and I won't be able
to blame her for either one. Perhaps I'll even write a book about
this place one day—I imagine it would
sell quite well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.text:
Oh, one last thing: I learned to say 'Epuyke
nogonoa kowo' in the local dialect. People say
this to me constantly, and it roughly means,
'May the blossoms of the Epuyke watch over you.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.text:
Well, it's time for me to go.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo, my precious Nana.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_250.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_250.text:
Did the guidance of the god of
the Imeru lead us here, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_260.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_260.text:
Are ye crying, love!? Oh my days!
Did I say something wrong?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_270.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_270.text:
I don't... I don't even
know how to answer that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_280.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_280.text:
I'm so sorry, Nana.
I don't know what to say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_290.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_290.text:
You don't need to say anything.
But it's time for Mom to tell me
everything she knows about this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_300.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_310_CUT_010_300.text: Then let's return to the village.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_000.text:
I found this on the ground—do you know
what it is? I think it may have belonged
to a past Soyay, because it's definitely
not from this world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_010.text:
It's some kind of record;
the data is undamaged.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_030.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_030.text:
FILE GREEN 105:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_040.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_040.text:
The residents claim the Epuyke flower
purifies the dreams of an evil deity
they call Ancikar. But if we assume that to be true, surely this
evil god would consider the process of a maiden
becoming the flower and absorbing its power
to be an act of aggression.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_050.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_050.text:
But no hostile relationship can last forever,
so perhaps this is better thought of as kind
of forced symbiosis where both the maiden
and Ancikar gain something.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_060.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_060.text:
FILE GREEN 080:
QUESTIONABILITY OF ANCIKAR'S EXISTENCE

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_070.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_070.text: Has any resident actually seen the evil deity Ancikar? The clerics refuse to answer when I ask to see records of its awakening—or to even confirm such records exist at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_080.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_080.text:
Perhaps Ancikar is not a living being at all,
but instead a metaphor for natural phenomena—
one which serves much the same purpose as dragons
and demons in the myths of other worlds. If so, there would be records of eruptions,
floods, and the like—and these things would
still be happening.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_090.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_090.text:
The Imeru have a magical civilization mature
enough to summon ritual attendants from other
worlds, yet continue carrying out an arcane
practice where one of them becomes the Epuyke. It is a truly fascinating dichotomy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_100.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_100.text:
FILE GREEN 208:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN #36

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_110.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_110.text:
Let us assume for the moment the hypothesis
that the maiden does not absorb and purify
Ancikar's magic is correct. Perhaps, then, in exchange for receiving the
maiden's life force in the form of her soul,
Ancikar returns that same force to the earth
in the form of energy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_120.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_120.text:
FILE GREEN 005:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN #908

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_130.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_130.text:
What if Ancikar does not exist as an individual
being, but is instead an aggregate of all the
sacrificed maidens' souls? How much remorse
and anger would such a creature possibly hold?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_140.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_140.text:
And what if the Maiden's Garden—the place
said to be the destination for the souls
of all maidens who become the Epuyke—
is Ancikar itself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_160.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_160.text:
I came here by chance as an inspector,
and have been attempting to examine my
hypotheses and speculations from the
viewpoint of a rational scholar. And yet, there is a mythical makeup
to this world that science, biology,
and even folklore cannot fully explain.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_170.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_170.text: An example of this is how those who ingest the Epuyke's pollen are unable to leave this world. ...But it tasted so good.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_180.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_180.text:
I believe roughly 50,000 cycles of base time have
passed since I arrived. And while many others—
called Pollinators—have been summoned here, there
have been no other inspectors from the base. This is most unfortunate. Sadly, there's little
I can do other than leave this here in the hopes
that another of my kind will eventually find
their way here and read it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_190.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_190.text:
Goodness, there was heaps
of useful data in there!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_200.text:
I don't understand any of that.
What were they trying to say?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_210.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_210.text:
They were speculating on a connection between the
maidens and Ancikar. The theory is fascinating,
but there's no actual evidence to back it up,
so I wouldn't put too much stock in it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_220.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_220.text:
Unless ye believe that Ancikar is
actually made up of past maidens?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_230.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_230.text:
No. No, that's not possible. I mean,
it would be the gravest of insults to
think of the maidens as evil. I mean, sure, waking up one morning with markings
that mean you're now a maiden is probably hard to
accept for some people. But the idea it leads to
a grudge? To some kind of...eternal rage? No. Whoever wrote all of that clearly
doesn't understand the Imeru at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_240.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_240.text:
I'm afraid I cannae weigh in conclusively one
way or the other; like the god of the Imeru,
I've precious little data on Ancikar.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_250.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_250.text:
I don't need your data, Soyay.
I just need you to guide me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_260.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_KIERU_320_CUT_010_260.text:
Aye, you're right. I'm sorry, love.
I'll guide ye with my whole being.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_000.text:
There are so many things I want to talk
to you about, Mom, but I don't even
know where to... I mean...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_010.text:
We found a diary belonging to Hasumi in the
Kieru Ruins. She wrote about how she came
to this world as a Soyay—and also about Nuy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_020.text:
Is that so? I was unaware Hasumi
left any records behind... Yes, well, let me start from the beginning.
This is all from memory, mind, so it might differ
slightly from Hasumi's diary, but believe me
when I say I have no intention to deceive you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_030.text:
It's okay, Mom. I know you're
not that kind of person.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_040.text:
Nuy received the markings of the maiden when
she was younger than Nana is now. Everyone was
delighted to have a maiden from Berta Village,
and our family doubly so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_050.text:
Soon, the Soyay arrived—that was Hasumi—
with a baby in her arms. The child was
far different than Imeru seedlings,
but adorable all the same.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_060.text:
None of us had ever heard of a Soyay with a baby,
including the clerics. Seeing them at a loss for
how to handle the situation, I offered to care
for the child—for you, Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_070.text:
Nuy and Hasumi left soon thereafter
on the journey of trials, but along
the way, Hasumi...she perished.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_080.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_080.text:
Yet Nuy managed through to the end
and bloomed into a beautiful Epuyke—
one filled both with her own spirit
and the steadfast heart of Hasumi.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_090.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_090.text:
Hasumi left this for me before she departed,
and told me to give this to Nana should
anything happen. I should have done this
much sooner, but... Well, here it is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_100.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_100.text:
A photograph—one I suspect was taken in
Hasumi's original world. She's holding a
baby—who I assume is ye—and there are
a few other people standing about.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_120.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_120.text:
Aye, as is the tradition
in photographs.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_130.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_130.text:
I raised you in Hasumi's stead.
It was difficult, since you are
not Imeru, but I could not bear
the thought of losing you. That's why I never showed you this
picture: because if you saw it and
chose to leave, I...I couldn't...

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_140.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_140.text: I know how hard you worked for me, Mom, and I'm truly, truly grateful. Without you, I would have been dead a long time ago. So no matter what I learn and no matter what I see, I will always be your little girl.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_150.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_150.text:
But I do have one question:
why did you dress me in my
birth-mother's clothes?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_160.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_160.text:
I thought the god of the Imeru might
have chosen you as the maiden so you could
return to your original world, and... Well, I suppose I just
wanted you to fit in.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_170.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_170.text:
I'm Imeru, Mom—I wouldn't have the faintest
IDEA what to do if I was thrown back into my
own world after all this time. I think the
god of the Imeru understands that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_180.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_180.text: We should return to the ritual, Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_190.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_190.text:
Even though I'm very confused about what
the Imeru god wants from me, I'm going
to do what I am meant to do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_200.text: I love you, Mom. Epuyke nogonoa kowo.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyay the Pollinator.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Do you understand the relationship
between Ancikar and the Epuyke, Maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Sure do! The Epuyke transforms the evil god
Ancikar's dreams into blessings for the land,
keeping Ancikar asleep and protecting us all
from his wickedness.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
You speak true. Then tell me, do you
understand the relationship between
the Imeru and the Kikir?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
The Imeru provide the Maiden of
the Epuyke, while the Kikir fight
Ancikar's fiends. Some Imeru think the Kikir don't do anything,
but that's wrong. All of them put their lives
on the line every day for this world's
peace and prosperity.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
My mom's been teaching me about all of this
since I was young; she wanted to make sure
I understood this world better than anyone.
And I was interested in the Kikir anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
I expect no less from Yuk. She comes from
a line of exceptional maidens, and raised you
to be a fine individual. This is doubtless why
you were chosen to be the maiden!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
I know many Imeru who have strong opinions on
your being a maiden, but we Kikir mind not the
differences between you and the maidens of the
past. We care only that you believe in yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.text:
Lead the Epuyke's maiden well, Soyay
the Pollinator. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.text: This is where the trial will be held.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.text:
Know that many Soyay lives have
been forfeited in this very trial,
so do not let your guard down. I shall now summon the fiend...
O great god of the Kikir, bring us
a mighty fiend from a world beyond!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_310_CUT_010_0.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator! You have done very well in your trial,
and I pray you might become the Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
You are Hasumi's daughter,
are you not?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text: So it seems. Is that a problem?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
Those of us who aid in the Epuyke's trials
do not record the names of either maidens
or Soyay, for to do so may lead to doubts
over the Imeru god's choices.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
However, no summoner of strength could
ever forget the names of Hasumi or Nuy,
because it is they who taught us the true
meaning of the trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
We believed the trial of strength was simply
a way to test the Soyay's physical prowess.
We thought there was only meaning in victory. Alas, our thinking was shallow;
the significance of the trial
runs far, far deeper.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text: Though Hasumi lost her life in the trial, her heart was bound to Nuy—and consequently, Nuy bloomed into a beautiful Epuyke. So you see, the true significance of this trial is to test the bond between the hearts of the maiden and her Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
Hear me, Soyay the Pollinator.
I expect your hearts to find their
true bond through this trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
We defeated the fiend, but it's not
possible for our hearts to connect,
because I don't have one.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
I'm not sure about that, but I DO know
I wanted you to win more than anything! I know Nuy was thinking the same thing
when she watched Hasumi fight, too.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
But Hasumi lost all the same.
Ach... I'm so sorry, love.
I shouldn't have said anything.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
She gave her life for Nuy, but what are the
people who get left behind even supposed to
DO with that? Hell, maybe the only choice is
to risk my OWN life and—

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
Please don't be rash. I'm still alive,
and I have no intention of leaving
ye all on your lonesome.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
I have just witnessed a miracle: Hasumi's heart
has crossed the boundaries of time to bond with
her daughter. I will now cherish and care for
this trial even more. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love. Your task is thus: take these
vine seeds and plant them in
the holes upon the plateaus.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_020.text: I've nae heart, and therefore nae love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Um... Aren't you going to ask
me the meaning of this trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_300_CUT_000_040.text:
What meaning the maiden assigns to
this trial is left to her discretion. What meaning is there in choosing the holes?
In spreading the seeds? In Ancikar's fiends?
In the very vines themselves? I would have you think on all these
things with a heart full of love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_000_000.text:
Should we put the seeds
in this hole, then?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_010.text:
I've always tried to picture what
kind of seed I sprouted from. I mean, I figure it's different from most
other people's, so I always imagined it 
as being sort of transparent and shiny.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_020.text:
People of your race don't come from seeds.
Ye grow in your mother's womb before
eventually emerging once ye have the
biological capability to exist outside.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_010_030.text:
WHAAAT!? But if you sprouted from your
mom's stomach, that means she DIED!
Nuh-uh, no way! Keep your creepy
world the hell away from me!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_020_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_020_000.text:
We defeated the fiends, which should
provide plenty of tasty nutrients.
Now we just wait for it to sprout.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_000.text:
So what meaning is there in the vines, huh?
I mean, I've been thinking with a loving heart
like I'm supposed to, but I can't see anything
but...you know. Vines. Is this what it's like to become
the Epuyke? It seems so superficial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_010.text:
I cannae understand any of this,
love, as I don't have a heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_LOVE_310_CUT_030_020.text:
Guess I never should've asked my Soyay in the
first place, huh? Or are you just trying to
tell me in a roundabout way to think about it
myself? Well, I will! Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Nana,
Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Aren't you nervous because
I'm not Imeru?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_030.text:
You have been chosen by the god of the Imeru.
To find unease in this fact would be to show
distrust and insult to our deity.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_040.text:
You were raised here. You are Imeru.
We expect great things from you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_050.text:
And I'm gonna do everything I can
to live up to those expectations!

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_300_CUT_000_010.text:
It didn't grow out of the ground
itself... There was a maiden...

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_040.text:
Only people who want seeds eat pollen.
I'm, uh...not old enough for that yet.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_050.text:
Ye must be a certain age to eat it?
That is fascinating information.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_020.text:
Become the Epuyke!
Feed us tasty pollen!

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_030.text: Do you think I can do that?

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_040.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_040.text:
Absolutely! I know you'll shower
us with tasty, tasty pollen.

SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_340_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_DIVA_POLLEN_340_CUT_000_020.text: I'm working on my trials now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_050.text:
So I'm absolutely going to do my
best here, but I have one request: When I become the Epuyke, will you please
look after Mom? I want her to live the
rest of her life without worry.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_060.text:
Worry not, she will be treated very well.
Relatives of the Epuyke are valuable—and as
she raised you to be the Maiden of the Epuyke,
her experience is doubly so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_070.text: Well, you're right about that: Mom is an exceptional Imeru.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_080.text:
We pray you will bloom into an
equally exceptional Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Nana!
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_050.text:
I finally feel like I can do this, Soyay—
and if I DO manage to become the Epuyke,
it'll all be because of you. So...thanks.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_090.text:
Proper strange, this. It's a seed,
yet I still sense Nana from it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_050.text:
If I manage to become the Epuyke, it's
all going to be because of you, Soyay.
Thanks for everything you did for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_060.text:
I dinnae do it alone: Hasumi and Yuk
both helped to guide ye.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_070.text:
You're right. I feel like...
I can do this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_110.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_110.text:
This is definitely a seed, yet I still sense
Nana from it. It seems she really did
manage to become the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_120.text:
I questioned the Imeru god's choice at first,
just as I did when her mother was summoned as
the Soyay—but I see now all was done according
to our god's great plan. Praise be to mother and daughter!
Praise be to Soyay and Epuyke!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_050.text:
Do you think I'll be able to bloom
into the Epuyke? I mean, I haven't
actually done ANYTHING!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_060.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_060.text:
'Tis a greater than zero
chance, at the least.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_070.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_070.text:
It will not work. The ritual is a failure.
Ancikar refuses to accept a maiden
that is not Imeru!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_090.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_090.text:
I couldn't do it, Soyay! I'm useless!
My body is useless and I can't change it!
Why did the Imeru god even choose me!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_100.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_100.text: I will graft in her place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_110.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_110.text:
Return to your people, Nana.
This is the will of the Imeru god.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_120.text:
Indeed. Ancikar will most
certainly accept Yuk.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_140.text:
There's no time!
Come, Yuk! This way!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_000.text:
That animal body was quite convenient for
Ancikar, was it not? Indeed, Ancikar has never
before manifested in this manner!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_010.text:
According to my sensors, this isn't Ancikar,
but Nana. It's the Nana I've always known,
and I intend to prove it to ye!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_020.text:
Now lend me your strength as the
maiden of the Epuyke, Nana!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_000.text: This is an Epuyke seed. This is Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_010.text:
A great deal of Ancikar's power was necessary
to transform Maiden Nana into the Epuyke;
the god of the Imeru summoned a most
powerful Soyay for this very reason.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_020.text:
I'm chuffed I was able to help in the end.
I was able to guide the Epuyke's maiden,
and I owe it all to Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_030.text:
Indeed, we stand corrected:
this Epuyke had a heart more
like an Imeru than any other.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_000.text:
Nana has become the new Epuyke, then.
I'm afraid I don't understand just how
amazing that is, but I suspect she has
something inside her that I lack.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's
Epuyke festival as the 1,080,362nd
Soyay the Pollinator. I now pronounce
you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_030.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_030.text:
Do ye mind if I stay here until the
Epuyke blooms? Or do I have to
be off right away?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_050.text:
I know that may be a strange thing to be asking
that now my duty as Soyay is over, but there
remains a possibility it will lead to my heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_060.text:
You are now merely a thing, and we
cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
1,080,363rd Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_070.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_070.text:
But we have one thing for you.
The Epuyke was clad in these.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_080.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_080.text:
Nana's clothes. Aye, but I cannae wear clothes
in this body, so I feel like they should be
returned to their original owner, Yuk.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 1,080,362nd Soyay the Pollinator!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_010.text: I am a Soyay no longer.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_020.text:
You will always be Nana's Soyay—
and as such, I would like you
to take these when you go.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_040.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_040.text:
She chose to live her life as an Imeru,
but I believe she harbored a wish in
her heart to see other worlds. So please...
Take at least a part of her with you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_050.text:
I will rebuild the data I have on Nana.
Let us go forth together then, love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_000.text:
I'm so sorry this had to happen.
Why did the god of the Imeru choose
someone like me in the first place?
I was never fit for this task.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_010.text:
A question we hope to ask the god ourselves,
for never once has a Soyay so irresponsible
ever been summoned to us. But enough of this—we must begin the
trials for the next maiden and Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's
Epuyke festival as the 1,080,362nd
Soyay the Pollinator, and I now
pronounce you freed from your duty. Now please leave.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_000.text:
I sure hope you're okay with this, Mom.
I mean, at least you'll have company,
since Nuy is in the Maiden's Garden. I know now that Nuy's my older sister,
and I really hope you both find peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_010.text:
I miss you, Mom, and I...
I don't know what I’m going
to do without you. *sniff*

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_030.text:
Ugh, what a mess. I mean, if I'm like this,
how is Mom supposed to rest easy as she
goes over to the other side?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_040.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_040.text:
I plan to stay until the Epuyke blooms,
but what will ye do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_020.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_020.text: I think she can hear us.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_040.text: What is it, Mom? Did you see Nuy?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_060.text:
She's gone to the Maiden's Garden...
I sure hope she's happy getting to
see Nuy again after all this time.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_000.text:
Thank you for everything, Soyay.
I mean it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_010.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_010.text:
I am no longer a Soyay. I am just D05-72314,
or Songstress Diva No. 5. So what are ye gonna
do from this point on, love?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_040.text:
Mom wanted me to leave this world once
my trials were finished, and that's exactly
what I'm gonna do! Er, I mean, if that's
all right with you, Diva?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_050.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_050.text:
You're willing to help search
for my heart? Thank ye, love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_070.text:
Thanks, but I'm Imeru, and I need
to protect my mom's lineage. One day, I'll eat the Epuyke's pollen,
harbor a seed inside me, and raise a
maiden like Nuy. I just hope I can
do it all as good as Mom did.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_080.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_080.text:
That's... Nae, if that's what ye want,
I'll support ye all the way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_090.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_090.text:
Oh, but I don't need these clothes anymore,
so you can have them. I'd like you to take them
to my birth mother's world if you ever get the
chance. But for now, Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.text: This is Nana's pollen. It holds a portion of her genetic information, as well as her heart. ...Wait. Her heart?

SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.speaker: Diva_No5
SUB_W11_EVAR_DIVA_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.text:
Nana's data has been reconstructed, and a
portion of her heart has been recreated.
I wonder if it's possible to build my own
heart like this, then?
